intro: Eritrichium virens, commonly known as the greenweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a hairy surface, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green in color. Eritrichium virens is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
